article.title: Quantitative indexing and Tardigrade analysis of exoplanets

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 1 plots interior NESI against surface NESI for different celestial bodies. What is the approximate upper limit for NESI as marked by the solid line in the figure?
Formula (2) defines the New Earth Similarity Index (NESI). How many physical parameters are included in the calculation of NESI?
Figure 2 shows the relationship between interior NTSI and surface NTSI. What type of celestial bodies are represented by the blue dots in the figure?
Formula (9) provides the equation for calculating the global Tardigrade Similarity Index (TSI). What does TSI represent?
choices: The likelihood of finding intelligent life on an exoplanet.
The potential habitability of an exoplanet for humans.
The similarity of an exoplanet\'s composition to Earth.
The possibility of tardigrade survival on an exoplanet.
